reviewText: WASN'T AWARE OF THIS STORY, SO I ENJOYED IT IMMENSELY. BEING A NAVY VETERAN MYSELF, I WAS ABLE TO RELATE TO IT THAT MUCH MORE.
Title: Proud

reviewText: I really enjoyed the story as one that needs to be told. A black crew in WW II was something needing to be recognized. These men served their country well.  They used so much stock footage that I felt like I was cutting to old John Wayne movies and back to a modern one.Still very worth your time to watch.
summary: The story it tells is excellent. The technology feels low budget.
Title: Proud

reviewText: Thank you for shipping this so neatly and securely. I was glad to have this to add to my collection as it's somewhat different from other African-American movies that I have seen.
Title: Proud

reviewText: What a great move a must see for all and this stroy is a true story about blacks in the US Navy during WW II We see how they served our country and how our country treated them. I would like to thank all WW II vets for their service and I would like to say a special thanks to our African American Men and Women who servered with honor and pride. They didn't want anything they just wanted to PROUD Americans just like every other American.
Title: Proud

reviewText: This is an awesome movie!!! My family and I enjoyed watching this movie and plan to let our other family members view this movie over the holidays... It was educational and a good look at history. I do recommend everyone trying this movie.
Title: Proud

reviewText: ARRIVED ON TIME AND THE DISC PLAYED FLAWLESS.  THANK YOU
Title: Proud

reviewText: A great story that you probably have never heard about. Great acting, characters, and actors. I will watch this again.
Title: Proud

reviewText: One of the greatest stories never told. A part of a history we continually find ways to deny or simply overlook.
Title: Proud

reviewText: This had to be the MOST boring, slow, movie I have ever watched!  Would have rather watched ..paint dry!!!!!!!  Actually went to sleep during the first 30 min.!  Don't  waste your money on this one!
Title: Proud

reviewText: Good telling of an age-old story.  Provides a good chance to share with youngsters of the significance of Black participation in the Navy, Coast Guard, Marines.  What is seen more often are accounts of those in the Army or the Airforce.  So, it's forgotten that Black men (and women) fought in the other branches of the armed forces too.  Thought at times some of the acting was a bit bland.. .but all in all a good film.
Title: Proud

reviewText: It is always good learning the history of African-American Americans andtheir roles in the US military  - Thre TRUE and DEDICATED heores.The REAL heroes are often ignored in American history.
Title: Proud

reviewText: I just want to say that I am glad that I ordered this DVD from Amazon.  It is a very good and informative movie.  I was getting ready to watch a DVD one night and this movie was one of the preview movies before my movie started.  I don't even remember which movie it was on now.  I did not know anything about the USS Mason and its crew until I ordered the movie and watched it.  Ossie Davis, Darnell Williams and the other actors in the movie were astounding.  This movie can also be used as something for Black History Month because it is Black History.  In all, I think everyone should see this movie regardless of who you are.
Title: Proud

reviewText: Based on the true and heroic story of the USS Mason, a Navy battleship manned by an African-American crew during WWII, when segregation was still enforced. Based on the book by Mary Pat Kelly.The prosSome pretty solid performances by the cast. Some scenes were very enjoyable. Nice to see a all African American cast and no one is a drug dealer,pimp or thug. Glad to see these events portrayed on film. The scene with them visiting some Irish people was very enjoyable. Footage of actual navy vessels in battle. Ending of the film has footage of Bill Clinton talking with some of the surviving crew members.The consI hated how they couldn't decide if they wanted to be documentary or a movie. You have Ossie Davis talking all over the film explaining things I don't need that just show what happened in the film. Man the sets were kind of cheap in the film. You could tell they didn't have much money for this film. I didn't get some of the choices in term of script. They wasted a lot of time with one character interviewing other charters in the film. This happened a few times. I'd have rather they spent this time doing something more interesting. Also during the battle scenes they use actually footage of real navy ships in battle. This would be cool if the scenes weren't in black and white. I found this really jarring at times. It really took me out of the battles. Also the main antagonist who was causing them problems get taken out of the picture 40% into the film. I know it's based on real life,but it hurt the film. You don't get rid of the main bad guy so soon.In conclusion I'd say good idea with poor execution. Don't know why some people gave it such a high rating,but don't be fooled.
summary: A decent film. Worth watching on cable,but not buying.
Title: Proud
